dict.acceptation: 模糊的；（思想上）不清楚的；（表达或感知）含糊的；暧昧的；

sent.orig: Tremmel said she has a vague recollection of a hospital minister at her bedside.
sent.trans: 阿尔玛称，她只是隐约记得一个医院主任站在床边。

sent.orig: The directions are so vague that it is impossible to complete the assignment.
sent.trans: 这指示是如此地模糊，以致于任务无法完成。

sent.orig: Try to imagine something penetrating my groin, but have only a vague sensation of pain.
sent.trans: 我在想象一件东西穿透两腿间那个地方的情形，不过只有一点隐隐约约的痛感。

sent.orig: She had a vague premonition of danger.
Hitherto I have gone on vague lines.
